subSubSection.paragraph: Structure: All body shiny. Head with only a few short setae and distinct transversal sutura in lateral view. All labial segments with short, erected setae. Second visible labial segment reaching over posterior margin of head. Anterior margin of anterior pronotal lobe as well as anterior margin of mesosterna and anterior and posterior part of metasterna with robust, very dense, short and strongly curved setae. Longitudinal suture of anterior pronotal lobe very short, deeply hollowed and visible only in ½ basal half. Calli small, not covered by hairs. Lateral lobes of anterior pronotal lobe thinned dorsally with rounded apices (in lateral view triangular in shape). Lateral parts of posterior pronotal lobe convolute on posterior margin; distinct depressions in lateral parts. Posterior pronotal lobe with delicate depression in the middle, some females with longitudinal depressed line. Posterior lobe with several, medium sized setae. Scutellum with short, rounded apex covered by very short, curved, dense setae. Trochanters, femora and tibiae with various sized (mostly long) setae. Hemelytra slender and short but surpassing apex of abdomen. Corium shinny. Costal vein in basal part with short, strongly curved and dense setae present on 2 / 3 of its length. Abdomen beneath with medium sized setae.

Measurements (in mm, male in parentheses): Body length: 9.25–9.75 ( 8.3–8.42 ); maximum width of abdomen: 3.08–3.33 ( 2.5–2.6 ); head length: 1.5–1.67 ( 1.5 ); head width: 1.25–1.33 ( 1.17–1.21 ); length of anteocular part: 0.42–0.5 ( 0.3–0.42 ); length of postocular part: 0.54–0.67 ( 0.5–0.59 ); length of synthlipsis: 0.67–0.75 ( 0.5–0.58 ); interocellar distance: 0.29–0.33 ( 0.25 ); length of antennal segments I:II:III:IV: 2.08–2.25 ( 1.8–1.83 ): 1–1.08 ( 0.75– 0.8 ): 1.58–1.75 ( 1.34–1.75 ): missing ( 2.75 ); length of labial segments I:II:III: 0.83–0.92 ( 0.67–0.75 ): 0.92–1 ( 0.79–0.96 ): 0.29–0.33 ( 0.21–0.3 ); maximum length of anterior pronotal lobe: 0.67–0.75 ( 0.58–0.83 ); maximum length of posterior pronotal lobe: 1.5–1.58 ( 1.17–1.33 ); maximum width of anterior pronotal lobe: 1.25–1.58 ( 1.21–1.33 ); maximum width of posterior pronotal lobe: 2.5–2.85 ( 2.42–2.5 ) length of scutellum: 0.67–0.83 ( 0.67– 0.75 ); length of hemelytra: 6.16 – 5.54 ( 5.42–5.75 ).
Etymology. The name of the species is connected with the dark colouration of the body.
